text: Cara Black and Elena Likhovtseva were the defending champions, but lost in semifinals to Conchita Martínez and Patricia Tarabini. Virginia Ruano Pascual and Paola Suárez won the title by defeating Conchita Martínez and Patricia Tarabini 6–3, 6–4 in the final. It was the 13th title for Ruano Pascual and the 21st title for Suárez in their respective doubles careers. It was also the 3rd title for the pair during the season, after their wins in Bogotá and Acapulco. ==Seeds== The first four seeds received a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ===Bottom Half=== ==Qualifying== ===Seeds=== ===Qualifiers=== # Rossana de los Ríos / Lilia Osterloh ===Lucky Losers=== # Tatiana Panova / Tatiana Poutchek ===Qualifying Draw=== ==References== * Official results archive (ITF) * Official results archive (WTA) Women's Doubles Italian Open – Doubles
title: 2002 Italian Open – Women's Doubles
